definition: to exculpate/to absolve/to exonerate

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to absolve sb from guilt/to exonerate/to exculpate

sentences.english: He made up a story to explain his absence.
sentences.chinese: 他编造谎言为他的缺席开脱。

sentences.english: But there is a troubling subtext: the author’s attempts to exculpate himself.
sentences.chinese: 不过令人烦恼的是，作者总打算替自己开脱。

sentences.english: After all, Dooku was too dangerous to be taken alive, rationalized Palpatine.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，杜库太危险了，不能活捉，帕尔帕廷为他开脱。

sentences.english: However, the Bush administration has its own exonerations and explanations.
sentences.chinese: 然而，布什政府则对其行为有责自己的解释和开脱。

sentences.english: Whitman was cleared of the conflict by the EPA inspector general.
sentences.chinese: 环境署监察长使惠特曼从以权谋私的指责中得以开脱。

sentences.english: Second, it absolves voters of responsibility for their problems.
sentences.chinese: 其次，民粹主义为选民自身的责任开脱。

sentences.english: This argument is only too blatantly an alibi for domestic repression.
sentences.chinese: 这一辩解完全是在为国内的镇压活动开脱。

sentences.english: Set a good time, the phone will be sounded, who slipped to absolve.
sentences.chinese: 设定好时间，手机就会响起来，开脱溜身之用。

sentences.english: Edison rushed out and carried the boy to safety.
sentences.chinese: 爱迪生冲上去把孩子抱开脱了险。

sentences.english: The fact that the man has performed no action does not excuse him.
sentences.chinese: 虽然这个人什么都没有做，但他并不能因此开脱罪责。

sentences.english: For absolving Song escort department want and the scapegoat are made by him actually.
sentences.chinese: 为了开脱宋押司硬是要把他做替罪羊。

sentences.english: The king asked her this is for Chu Beijie excuse?
sentences.chinese: 晋王问她这是要替楚北捷开脱吗？

definition: to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
to absolve sb from guilt/to exonerate/to exculpate
to speak in defense of/to argue in favor of/to defend/to plead
to look for a pretext
to complain of an injustice/to lament sb's misfortune
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to quibble
to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to be outraged by an injustice
to make an excuse/pretext/excuse
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]
